[SYNTAX]: Occasionally complex sentence structures may impede immediate clarity (e.g., "We are always sowing our future; we are always reaping our past.")
[LEXICON]: Some archaic or less common vocabulary (e.g., "luckless", "sceptre", "Kanakas") might require additional effort for modern readers

[TRANSITION]: Abrupt shift from discussing the Industrial Revolution and French monarchy to the United States Government's action without clear contextual link
[STRUCTURE]: Non-sequential narrative jumps (e.g., from the ship's departure to a detailed description of Honolulu attractions without a smooth connection)

[SYNTAX]: Abrupt transition between descriptions of Filipino attire and the discussion of art (Reynolds, Italy)
[LEXICON]: Sudden shift in vocabulary tone (from descriptive ethnography to art critique)
[GRAMMAR]: Minor: "the surplus part knotted and tucked with the thumb under the part already wrapped around the body" (slightly unclear)

[STRUCTURE]: Unconnected sub-sections (Filipino women's attire, Art discussion, Manila's history, Bridge scene, Art history again, Back to Manila life)
[TRANSITION]: Lack of transitional phrases or sentences between vastly different topics
[LOGIC]: Inclusion of unrelated art historical analysis disrupts the narrative's geographical and cultural focus
